title: fix some spell mistake for iotdb-engine conf
Delete vector data bug
body:
# Reproduction:
- stand-alone:
insert some vector data to root.ln
delete from root.*
select * from root.ln
500 NPE occurs
 - Reason: The delete logic and vector don't coordinate well
- cluster:
insert some vector data to root.ln
delete from root.*
select * from root.ln
data still exists
 - Reason:  Vector does not currently support single column deletion

title: [IOTDB-1220] MQTT example may have timestamp precision issue
body:
## Description
The issue description is in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-1220 . 

The reason is the time between two insertions may be too fast and less than 1ms. 
Therefore, let me change the MQTT example in this PR.

title: [To rel/0.12] [IOTDB-1325] StackOverflow Exception in group by natural month query
body:
Steps:

insert into root.sg.d1(time,s1) values(1522425600000, 1)

select count from root.sg.d1 group by ((2018-01-31, 2018-03-31],1mo)

Reason:

Copy() method of GroupByMonthFilter doesn't deep copy enough elements.

title: JDBC bug - check authority for execute batch
body:
1. when user does not have "create timeseries" privilege, JDBC allows user to create timeseries using executeBatch() interface. this adds authority check
2. when multiple errors occur, JDBC only shows user the last error message. this adds all error message with its SQL.

title: [To rel/0.12][IOTDB-1294] Compaction mods for new mods structure
body:
## Behavior
Delete operation become invalid after compaction.

## Reason
1. In `append merge`, the mods modify of chunkMetadata will not change the data of the chunk corresponding to it. However, we just merge the chunk data by BufferBytes and then delete the modification record.
2. As we change the structure of mods file in 0.12 (delete `version` and change it to `tsfileOffset` which means that only if the offset of the chunk <= `tsfileOffset`, then the modification record is valid). However, the position of chunk in tsfile may change after compaction.

## Solution
1. Do not use mods file in `append merge` and keep the modification record.
2. Update the `tsfileOffset` of remain modification record to Long.MAX_VALUE, which means that it will be valid for the whole tsfile.

title: Fix compaction remove parition
body:
## Behavior
Remove parition ci bug like below.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24886743/115662644-dd0a3e00-a371-11eb-9821-7d985ee6e88c.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24886743/115662656-e2678880-a371-11eb-9ea6-ddd24bf4dbb9.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24886743/115662674-e98e9680-a371-11eb-8dca-72e5a82dd2f5.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24886743/115662701-f1e6d180-a371-11eb-9a02-136c6a5c04a7.png)

## Reason
1. There is a getIterator method in TsFileManagement. However, it does not return the real iterator of tsfileList, removeParition use `iterator.remove()` to remove tsfileResource in the tsfileList which is invalid.
2. `seqFile.writeLock()` may be interrupted by the calling of removeParition, which make the lock invalid.

## Solution
1. Disable the use of `iterator.remove()` , use `tsfileManagement.remove(tsfileResource)` instead.
2. Check whether the current merge thread is interrupted after `seqFile.writeLock()`.

Moreover, this PR also update the usage of the merge lock.

title: [rel/0.12][IOTDB-1317] Log CatchUp always failed du to not check the follower's match index
body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-1317

When the follower lags behind the leader, it will catch up with the leader through the log. When it can't find the logs to catch up with in the memory of the leader, it will go to the file on the local disk to find the satisfied logs. The logs found are between the old match index and the commit index saved by the leader. However, at this time, the match index of the follower may have been updated and the old match index of the follower may have been deleted (in order to prevent a large number of logs from being kept on disk, there is a log deletion mechanism). So at this time, if you send the above logs to the follower, the follower will fail to find the matching log. At this time, this storage group will appear to write stuck phenomenon.

The solution is to re-check the match index of the follower after reading the log from the disk.

title: [IOTDB-1317] Log CatchUp always failed du to not check the follower's match index
body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-1317

When the follower lags behind the leader, it will catch up with the leader through the log. When it can't find the logs to catch up with in the memory of the leader, it will go to the file on the local disk to find the satisfied logs. The logs found are between the old match index and the commit index saved by the leader. However, at this time, the match index of the follower may have been updated and the old match index of the follower may have been deleted (in order to prevent a large number of logs from being kept on disk, there is a log deletion mechanism). So at this time, if you send the above logs to the follower, the follower will fail to find the matching log. At this time, this storage group will appear to write stuck phenomenon.

The solution is to re-check the match index of the follower after reading the log from the disk.

title: [IOTDB-1310] Enable docker, docker-compose and testcontainer for End to end test
body:
This PR fixes:

1. in the cluster module, set the default number of nodes as 1, and the default replica number as 1.

2. users can skip to set the value of `internal_ip`. If `internal_ip` is commented, then the hostname of the server will be used rather than `127.0.0.1` to be used.

3. add a new module `testcontainer`. The module will be added if your PC/Mac has installed Docker.

4. the `testcontainer` module will build two docker images: `apache/iotdb:maven-development` and `apache/iotdb:cluster-maven-development` when running `mvn pre-integration-test`

5. Two E2E test (end with *IT.java) with TestContainer framework examples are provided, in `testcontainer/src/test/java/`, while one is for single node and another is for the cluster with 3 nodes.

6. remove duplicated `verify` phash in `integration-test` phase.

7. To disable the `testcontainer` module, use `-P !testcontainer` in your `mvn` command.

8. In this PR, `spotless:check` is moved to a profile, which is enabled by default. To skip the step (for faster compiling, use `-P !spotless`).

title: [IOTDB-1294] Compaction mods for new mods structure
body:
## Behavior
Delete operation become invalid after compaction.

## Reason
1. In `append merge`, the mods modify of chunkMetadata will not change the data of the chunk corresponding to it. However, we just merge the chunk data by BufferBytes and then delete the modification record.
2. As we change the structure of mods file in 0.12 (delete `version` and change it to `tsfileOffset` which means that only if the offset of the chunk <= `tsfileOffset`, then the modification record is valid). However, the position of chunk in tsfile may change after compaction.

## Solution
1. Do not use mods file in `append merge` and keep the modification record.
2. Update the `tsfileOffset` of remain modification record to Long.MAX_VALUE, which means that it will be valid for the whole tsfile.

title: [IOTDB-1306] Fix DeadLock in MemControl module
body:
In current version, the insert thread will sleep with the sg write lock until the flush thread release some memory and the total memtable memory size is lower than the reject threshold in SystemInfo. 

But if there is a flush thread causes another memtable of this sg flushing, it would require the write lock that holden by the insert thread.

 **[Reason]**
the plan index is not set in the sub plans when we split the InsertRowsPlan, InertMultiTabletPlans and InsertRowsOfOneDevicePlan

title: optimize sync leader for meta
body:
## Description

In the distributed version, metadata synchronization will be performed when parsing SQL statements, which will lead to parsing time consuming up to 1 second. The main reason is that the heartbeat of the master is not received in time, which leads to the delay of the synchronization time. The root cause is that metadata and data belong to the same raft replication group, which affects the judgment of whether metadata is consistent or not.

The main idea of this pr is to reduce the time of synchronization point by getting the submitted information earlier. With weak consistency, we can get 20~30% query performance improvement.

3. total mem cost

When the system status is set to `NORMAL`, log:

repo.name: iotdb
repo.description: IoTDB (Internet of Things Database) is a data management system for time series data, which can provide users specific services, such as, data collection, storage and analysis. Due to its light weight structure, high performance and usable features together with its seamless integration with the Hadoop and Spark ecology, IoTDB meets the requirements of massive dataset storage, high throughput data input, and complex data analysis in the industrial IoT field.

title: [IOTDB-1278]limit the class name length <=25 in logback and reduce thread pool name length
body:
Currently, our log prints too many duplicated info (i.e., "org.apache.iotdb."), like:

```
2021-04-01 17:08:13,893 [pool-4-IoTDB-Compaction-ServerServiceImpl-thread-3] INFO  org.apache.iotdb.db.engine.compaction.level.LevelCompactionTsFileManagement:611 - root.group_44 start to filter compaction condition 
2021-04-01 17:08:13,894 [pool-4-IoTDB-Compaction-ServerServiceImpl-thread-3] INFO  org.apache.iotdb.db.engine.compaction.level.LevelCompactionTsFileManagement:689 - root.group_44 [Compaction] merge end time isSeq = true, consumption: 1 ms 
2021-04-01 17:08:13,894 [pool-4-IoTDB-Compaction-ServerServiceImpl-thread-3] INFO  org.apache.iotdb.db.engine.compaction.TsFileManagement:216 - root.group_44 no unseq files to be merged 
```

Logback allows us set the maximal className length. 
In this PR, I set the length <=25.

More, reduce the thread name length:

```
2021-04-01 17:08:13,894 [pool-4-IoTDB-Compaction-3] INFO  o.a.i.d.e.c.level.LevelCompactionTsFileManagement:689 - root.group_44 [Compaction] merge end time isSeq = true, consumption: 1 ms 
2021-04-01 17:08:13,894 [pool-4-IoTDB-Compaction-3] INFO  o.a.i.d.e.c.TsFileManagement:216 - root.group_44 no unseq files to be merged 
```
